Articles.Content:
Hi, 

 

Kerbin does not appear to be blocking comms - I can communicate with KSC even when on the far side. Is there a setting I have  by mistake or is this sometimes allowed if the network is over powered? 

 

Thanks,

RBS.

Edited April 17, 2017 by rockbloodystar

I can think of two things that could be causing this. You could be connected to one of the numerous connection points scattered over Kerbin, but this can be disabled when starting the game. Alternatively you could have "Atmospheric Planet Occlusion" (or something like that) turned all the way down, which means that atmospheric planets would be essentially invisible (or at least a whole lot smaller) to your Commnet connections. This is configured at the Advanced settings when creating your game.

Having a pilot on board also gives all the features of being connected to KSC, so if you have a pilot on board connection doesn't matter apart from science transmissions.

Hope I helped.

Can I find those settings in the save file to check that occlusion is on.

 

No pilots are up at the minute.

I don't know where to look in the save file for those things, but the Occlusion Modifier is definitely in the advanced section of the difficulty options when creating a new game. Option is there for both atmospheric and vacuum planets, but by default it shouldn't allow for direct connection through Kerbin. All the rest I can think of is that being set to 0, comms network turned off, or maybe a bug. If the line is visible straight to Space Center through Kerbin, then I'd say its either occlusion or a bug.

So in the save file the occlusion modifiers were set to zero.

 

Now changed and problem is fixed.

 

Thanks.
